A French Big Brother-style show featuring television personalities roughing it on a farm without electricity or running water is being sued after a number of animals died or were injured on set.
La Ferme Celebrites - Celebrity Farm - was one of France's most popular shows, attracting up to 8.5 million viewers. It featured a dozen minor stars, including small-time actors, socialites, singers, a transsexual, a former footballer and an ex-beauty queen, whose efforts trying to run the farm were filmed over 10 weeks.
The contestants suffered nothing more than public ridicule, but their co-stars - an unfortunate collection of chickens, sheep, goats, horses, cows and geese - allegedly fared far worse.
